name: Blackjack (Argus Specialists Publications)
overview: Blackjack is a digital version of the classic card game. The player can bet each turn up to 25000 dollars. The player has infinite money to spend, so he cannot go bankrupt. The bank is played by the computer. Normal blackjack rules apply. This includes insurance; whenever the dealer draws an ace as his first card the player may start an insurance side-bet which he wins if the dealer gets blackjack. Published in Commodore Disk User 1990/01 and in Your Commodore 1991/04 (Tape #16).
